headline: Easy Indian Butter Chicken
description: This creamy butter chicken recipe combines fragrant spices with simple ingredients like onion, butter, and tomato sauce for a tasty curry dish.

video.description: This classic Indian restaurant dish is easy to make at home.
video.name: Easy Indian Butter Chicken

name: Easy Indian Butter Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into bite-sized chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic, and cook slowly until the onion caramelizes to a dark brown, about 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine cream, tomato sauce, remaining butter, salt, cayenne pepper, and garam masala in a saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes. Stir in caramelized onions.
While the sauce is simmering, toss chicken with vegetable oil until coated. Season with tandoori masala and spread out onto a baking sheet.
Bake chicken in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 12 minutes.
Add cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make and my guests raved about it.

Super easy and delicious! I was worried it would be too spicy for my anti-spice children but they loved it. One said his mouth was tingling but not burning so it was good. Couldn't find tandoori masala at the market so used another recipe on here to make my own version. I didn't have enough heavy cream so used about a cup of milk as a sub, otherwise followed the recipe. Turned out amazing.
Thanks for sharing

Made it all the time before going vegan and is still very easy to make now that I am vegan. Just switch out the chicken with hunks of extra-firm tofu and use coconut milk or cashew cream instead of the cream. I just use a small spray of avocado oil instead of all the vegan butter. Still an amazing recipe!
Made it a couple of times, everyone always enjoys it. Easy to make, fairly quick as well.
This recipe was easy to make and was so delicious! 10/10

I made this recipe once exactly as it shows (picture) and a second time with the suggestions in the reviews. The original recipe is horribly greasy. I had to constantly stir the sauce to get all the butter and grease to mix with the cream. The taste was okay but I felt gross eating this. 1 cup of butter and 3 cups of cream is nasty. I made this again with a suggestion that said 1/4 cup butter instead of 1 cup and 1 can of evaporated milk instead of 3 cups cream. It made the sauce thicker and made it smell more like a real curry sauce. No grease! The new version is my absolute favourite and I make it every month 5/5 stars and it's healthier. I also don't add any salt. You don't need it.
amazing but not that easy

Excellent recipe! However I find that the ratio of meat to sauce is a bit off. I always double the amount of chicken. Also, the sauce is very thin. I'd like to find a way to thicken it without compromising the flavor. Despite this, it's a very, very delicious recipe and a go-to meal for friends and family

I made this exactly as written and found that it was a bit on the bland side. I researched other recipes which called for the same ingredients and found that many called for curry powder as well. I added a tablespoon into the recipe and it punched it up a bit. I'll definitely use this recipe again.
good job I would leave a 39643 star review if I could.

This was absolutely delicious! I made it per recipe except reducing the butter down to 4T total. It made a TON of sauce even with 2 pounds of chicken, will try the suggestion from the author of the evaporated milk for both a healthier and less sauce option next time.

Stellar! Minimal recipe changes:
-10% cream instead of heavy cream
-pan cooked chicken with no seasoning (didn’t have tandoori)
-used no salt added stewed tomatoes instead of sauce and puréed most of them
-onions and garlic took longer to brown than 15 mins on medium heat
-used one pan for onions/garlic, one pan for chicken, large pot for sauce, another pot to make plain rice side dish
Beyond delicious, first time making, picky son loved it (as did I), and now will find it hard to buy/eat frozen version - have been spoiled with this recipe! Had it again for lunch today. Not an everyday food though - the calorie and fat content is off the charts, but of course that’s why it tastes so incredible! Will make again, will recommend. Also, I never write reviews and created an account just to say thanks to mn!
Me and my honey made it together and we were pawging out of our freaking gord. 10/10
I pan fried the chicken in butter and spices. Only modification.

This was amazing but I substituted the heavy cream for a low fat version (Elmlea in the UK) and greatly reduced the butter - I really don't think it effected the flavour. I took the easy option and used frozen onions and frozen peppers and, in addition, I used Aldi's Tikka chicken thighs - with the skin removed and cooked in the oven with the sauce on top. Made it for a buffet for 10 people and made enough for 15, hoping there would be leftovers but folk were actually asking if there was any more!!
Resounding success.
Thank you
This recipe is absolutely amazing. I made it the other day for my coworkers and I got great reviews. Hands down best recipe there is.

I absolutely love this recipe!! Pretty easy to make, and tastes delicious!
I followed the advice in the comments and used coconut milk instead of heavy cream, and I also used thighs instead of breasts/added in mushrooms. Other than those changes, I basically followed the recipe and served w curry basmati rice.
Will definitely be saving this recipe for special occasions!

I have made this recipe many times now and my family is insanely in love with it!! I follow the recipe for the most part but I’m one of those people that seasons to taste so I use a bit more garam malsala and I add tandoori masala to the sauce. It is absolutely DELICIOUS!!!! Obviously if my family is asking for it regularly!!! Thank you for this recipe!!!!
Delicious! I used advice from the reviews and used a can of coving milk instead of 3 c cream. I also used curry powder in place of the masala because it’s what I had in hand.

It's called BUTTER chicken. That's why it has a cup of butter and three cups of cream – this recipe is very rich, so I wouldn't have it once a week or anything. But it tastes better than either of the Indian restaurants in town serve, and my whole family loved it. For once, I could taste the BUTTER in my butter chicken!
This looks incredibly yummy, I love south Asian cuisine! I recently got a new pizza stone and now I'm wondering how good this would be as a pizza.
This butter chicken looks so yummy and i'd love to try it as a pizza!!!!
It was easy and delicious. We cut the cream and butter, and poured it over cauliflower rice topped with scallions and coconut. So good!!

This was my first time to cook Butter Chicken and I think it turned out great. I did add more spices than the recommended
amount just to satisfy my need for more heat. Left overs kept and reheated well, no issues with separation. Will be making it again!
Best butter chicken it’s my favourite dish
Absolutely amazing!!
I LOVE this recipe! I follow the recipe exactly and serve it with garlic naan and jasmine rice. Even the 3 year old likes it (at least tonight she does, lol).
Used coconut cream instead of heavy cream. Turned out great- I'll be making this again!

First, I loved this recipe for butter chicken! I have tried several and this one will definitely stay in the rotation. It has more of a spicy kick than the others I've tried - which is a bonus for me.

Two things I'd change, though, for the next time around: More chicken, less heavy cream. I'm going to add at least another half-pound of chicken and try cutting the cream down to 2 cups rather than three. I don't really mind having a lot of sauce, but three cups seemed a little much.

Note: I couldn't find the tandoori masala at my local grocery stores. The bonus there was that I found I have an Indian grocery in the area. Problem solved and new things to explore!
I could not find any of the masala indicated in the recipe at our local shop, so I replaced it with biryani masala. Still tasted good though the family loved it.
I made the recipe exactly as written & it was delicious! I'm going to make the low-fat version that the OP posted next & compare the two.

Delicious, easy recipe - I cut the butter almost in half and used light cream instead of heavy cream, to try to make the dish a little lighter, and it still tasted great. Like some other reviewers, I browned the onions in the same pan that I eventually added all the sauce ingredients to. I also couldn’t find tandoori Masala at my grocery store, so I subbed curry powder instead. Served with naan and jasmine rice. I will definitely make this again!
I am convinced I followed the instructions carefully but perhaps not. The sauce flavour was way too creamy. Managed to salvage a decent meal by adding an additional can of tomato sauce.
Loved it! Turned out amazing

This was really delicious! I had garam masala that came in a pre-filled spice rack and I had no idea what to do with it. This recipe was perfect! I only used one stick of butter but I did use heavy cream. I used the garam masala to season the chicken because that’s what I had. I thought my onion was too big so I only used half but I regretted that. Haha Use a whole onion! I served it over white rice and we devoured it. Thanks for a great recipe!
Wow! This is an amazing recipe. My kids and I enjoyed this meal. I followed the directions and made no changes. I look forward to making this again.

I LOVE this dish. It's one of my favourite things to make.

One adjustment I would recommend is switching steps 2 and 3. Step 3 requires 30 minutes of simmering and by switching the steps the dish takes less time. Happy Cooking
Delicious recipe. Our sauce was a little soupy though. I would recommend using a third less butter & heavy whipping cream.

Loved this recipe. I read the reviews and took the advice of others who used only 
1/4 cup of butter and the carnation evaporated milk (2%). This turned out amazing, restaurant quality, and I was blown away by the result. You would never guess it has canned milk in it. Super!
The sauce is delicious. However, I think the chicken needs to soak in for a long time. A bit of chicken by itself is quite bland, but is wonderful with a spoonful of the sauce.
Super good. I accidentally added a little over a tablespoon of cayenne pepper even though it said a teaspoon but it still turned out very nice if you like a it to be spicy.

Very tasty and very keto-friendly!

Make the sauce with chicken and serve with riced cauliflower and keto-friendly pan bread!

Delish
Flavor was great! my sauce came out a little on the thin side, but I might've just not let it simmer for long enough... Will make again.

Excellent! Milder than I anticipated considering that it uses a full teaspoon of cayenne. I was not able to find the tandoori masala locally, so I used the garam masala on the chicken as well as in the sauce. It had a wonderful flavor, although I've ordered the tandoori masala and look forward to making the dish again following the recipe exactly.
Easy AND delicious! I didn’t have heavy cream so I used 3 cups of half and half. Worked perfectly but since this was my first time making it, I had no comparison.
This recipe is DELICIOUS!! I followed the recipe step by step! I will definitely be making it again!

I liked it, but it had too many spices and too much salt for my preference. I actually put in less than half of the salt called for and would cut it back even further. I would also cut the spices by half and start from there.
This was amazing, my kids kept saying how good this was, and so was my husband! We are super happy with the recipe, I did made it as originally posted. Loved it
Oh my gosh this was so good you can get another recipe for garlic naun and use it as a "chip in the salsa"
Doubled the recipe but only had one onion. Used 3 cups of heavy cream, one cup of milk, 2 cups of light coconut milk. After browning onions and garlic, put everything in a crockpot

I have made this recipe several times, always following the low fat directions, we love it. Tonight, when I realized I had no tomato sauce, I threw in canned stewed tomatoes. Still amazing! Thanks for the recipe, it’s a keeper!
The chicken melts in your mouth it is so moist and delicious.

Loved it - but had to make a few modifications based on what I had available. I used Coconut Milk in place of heavy cream - used Curry Powder because I didn’t have the Tandoori Masala. I did have to double the Garam Masala as it was a bit bland for our taste. I also added cashews and pineapple and garnished with Cilantro.

Tasted great! Was worried about the sauce but I followed through and it worked. It helped to put a lid on the pot so that the sauce did not dehydrate. I made this recipe twice and both times were a cinch. My family and I enjoyed it very much. Thank you!
My family loved this. I did use I can of evaporated milk and 1 c cream, curry since I didn’t have tandoori masala, and smoked paprika since I didn’t have cayenne. This is definitely a keeper.
amazing! recipe is simple to follow and tastes just like our local Indian place. My family loved it. thanks for the recipe
I cant believe I made this, tastes like the restaurants! I cant stop eating it! it came out DELICIOUS!
Delicious. Had to use 2% milk and Greek Yogurt instead of cream. Still great.
Used more quantity on the ingredients and added fresh chillies to make it hotter, you can use your choice of chillies. Simple great indian dish to love!!
SO GOOD. i make this literally once a week. i only use about 1 1/2 cups of cream tho:)
It was really good but I didn’t have 3 cups of heavy cream ... Don’t substitute!! It still tastes good but doesn’t look as nice
Reduced cayenne pepper by half and still had some heat. Next time I will double amount of chicken. Beautiful dish.
Made it exactly per the recipe, except added a bit more garam Marsala into the sauce. We all absolutely loved it. Thank you so much for the recipe!!

Absolutely FANTASTIC! Everyone loved it and this was even better the next day!
The directions are spot on! This is one of my favorites!

I wanted to make all of my husband's favorite Indian foods to keep his spirits up during the isolation of the pandemic. I had never made naan before and I feel like I can do better, BUT it tasted wonderful. My husband was very happy.
this recipe is great. so simple and easy to adjust. sometimes I replace one cup of heavy cream for a can of coconut milk or yogurt for some extra flavor.
OMG! I love Indian food, but I live too far from any major city to enjoy it. I made this today and all I can say is WOW! Now I need a naan bread recipe.
Amazing!!!!!

Oh man. Y’all are either going to love me or hate me for the wild and crazy variation that I just tried. You should know that I have never had butter chicken so I have no preconceived expectations. But I’m here to tell you that if you up for being brave, I’m really enjoying this. I don’t care that it’s not “authentic,” like you have had at your favorite restaurant. I do keep garam masala, and I did use that and followed the recipe in a general sense. I made this in one cast iron pot. I used one stick of butter, onions and garlic. I used one can of coconut milk, a can of crushed tomatoes and hold on to your hats... a block of cream cheese! I thought it needed a little more zip so I added another pinch of salt, an extra dribble of crushed red pepper and sprinkled some curry on at the last minute. I mean...don’t knock it until you try it. I had multiple blocks of cream cheese I needed to use up and one just materialized in my hand as I was considering options. I’m glad I did. Next time maybe I’ll try it the way it’s intended but I’m telling’ ya what...mmmmm!
So delicious! Both kids loved it. That NEVER happens! This will be a staple.

Excellent! My husband is not normally fan of exotic spices but said this was really good! I served it over jasmine rice. I only used half of the cream and I cooked this in one large pot, so I didn’t use the oil on the chicken. I let the chicken cook in the butter and red sauce and didn’t add the cream until the chicken was cooked through. Then I just let the cream warm up, stirring through the chicken and sauce. Glad we like it because now I have the spices!
I've made this several times now. The original way tastes best but the evaporated milk modification the OP posted is also delicious. Love this recipe!!
Great recipe. Only suggestion is to add about another pound of chicken.

This recipe was flipping fantastic. I have never tried to cook Indian food from scratch before, and it was fairly simple. ( If you cant find the masalas, as other reviewers mention, there are other recipes on this site for them). Anyhow, this smelled amazing, tasted even better. It may just be one of the tastiest things I have ever made. I was a bit overwhelmed by the amount of cream so I used 1/2 of the butter and 2/3 of the cream in the recipe, and still had plenty of sauce and taste. Next time I may try the evaporated or coconut mile, and I may cut the pepper a bit, as this was a bit too spicy for my picky eater kid.

I just made the recipe just how it is and absolutely love it. The only thing I added was pepper flakes since we all like it spicy. One thing I will change next time will be 2 cups of cream instead of 3.
I pretty much stuck to the recipe. It was fantastic. A wonderful dish if you want to introduce someone to Indian food.

This is really good and I love it so much we have it every day and we are not Indian but I am trying not to be racist but I love butter chicken so much I will probably try Saffron Resturant if I like Butter Chicken so much!!!!!

I have made this recipe several times now and we love it! One little change. I half the sauce recipe as it is way too much for the amount of chicken. First time I made it we were eating sauce for weeks. ??
Love it, absolute favorite! I double the garlic and spices.
Loved it. Used half and half, and topped with green onion.

I made this over two days, cooking chicken and onions/garlic one day and then making sauce and putting it all together the next night after work. I used the author’s recommendation to lighten it up. It was absolutely delicious and my family loved it (well not the picky teenager but he doesn’t count)! This is saved and will be made once or twice a month! Served it with basmati rice, naan, and aloo gobi (Allrecipes). Wonderful!

Worked out well making this casein-free with dairy-free Greek yogurt alternate and ghee. After browning, I bloomed the spices then added the rest of the sauce ingredients. I used skin-on bone-in chicken quarters (leg with thigh attached) and dry rubbed the tandoori then set it sit for 30 mins, then added more tandoori rub and then baked at 425° for 20 mins skin-side down. Turned chicken over and turned oven down to 375° and baked for another 20 mins. Removed from oven and added to the sauce (along with any crispy pan bits) then followed the recipe from that point forward. Served with rice cooker saffron rice and mustard seed roasted green beans (using some of the rendered chicken fat from the roasting pan).
Great! We doubled the Cayenne and it was perfect!

Made exactly as directed in the recipe. It was AMAZING! The only change I would make is to decrease the cayenne by 1/2. Otherwise it was perfect. I served it over quinoa and garbanzo beans since we are going low carb and it was still great! Thanks for the recipe!

I've made this recipe 4 times, twice I got perfections. Twice I got just okay. I finally figured out the secret - Simmer really REALLY low (like just barely bubbling). Too much heat causes the cream to separate, and the sauce loses it's creamy flavor and smooth texture.
Excellent flavor! Thank you for sharing!
Loved it! I made the lighter version that she mentioned in the comments (sub 1 can of evaporated milk instead of cream and cut the butter to 1/4c). Still phenomenal!
I made this with the recommendations from the top review (using evaporated milk) and it was great. I just have to get more people in the family to like Indian food!
So delicious! Everyone in my family absolutely went crazy for it. Even the people who don’t love Indian food loved it!

I agree with other reviewers regarding the amount of butter, cream, and pans involved in the original recipe. I saw the reduced calorie version and did a variation on this, and only used about 1/4 c. butter total, and used a can of evaporated milk. Unlike some reviewers I sautéed the chicken and tandoori in a skillet prior to adding to the sauce. I only used about 1/4 t. of the cayenne pepper because my daughter isn't big on a lot of spiciness, but used the regular amounts of garam masala and tandoori. I didn't add salt because I thought with the canned tomato sauce and other spices there was enough. Next time I think I will add some veggies. I saw one review that used coconut milk, which I also thought sounded great.

I’ve eaten a lot of butter chicken at ‘Indian’ restaurants and find this recipe matches or exceeds the taste found in any. I doctor the ingredients a little(mostly leg and thigh meat and cuttings when I’m portioning a whole bird) plus I always add potato cubes, cauliflower and broccoli flowerettes and carrot cubes to the pot. LOVE THIS RECIPE!!

Loved this recipe. I made it a second time with the following changes:
Whole milk instead of heavy cream. .
Everyone who has tried either version has had good things to say, this will be a regular meal in my house.

It’s such a shame that people do not know how misled they are when it comes to fats! Good healthy fats like butter from grass fed cows is packed with health as is cream that is not ultra pasteurized ! I use raw cream from Organic Pastures from grass fed pastured cows! It is not fat that causes heart disease but unhealthy vegetable oils ! In fact this recipe is great for the Keto diet if you leave carbs out like serving over rice or pasta! Very delicious recipe full of healthy ingredients! By the way ghee would be good or coconut oil!

I prepared this as written. Next time, I will make half the sauce recipe as it was way too much for the amount of meat. I will cut the salt proportionately in half as my family and I felt it was too salty. Very good, restaurant-style flavor and very rich.
I really liked the spices. I halves the recipe but kept the spices the same. I also added a tsp of green curry powder.

I made it as is except used chicken thighs instead of breasts. It was so good! The sauce alone was worth it. I have two vegetarian and vegan family members and they don’t know what they are missing. I suppose you could make it with tofu and fake butter.

I loved this recipe!! I found it greasy, so I ladled the excess butter out and used paper towels for the rest. I didn't have whipping cream so I used 2% milk and chicken stock to keep the the mixture hydrated. I used peppers and onions, what I had around the house. I finished with cilantro and naan as well as Jasmine rice. LOVE this recipe

This is the perfect easy buttered chicken. It’s not too heavy on the tomato flavor, not overly spicy. It’s delicious. I’ve made this for at least 10 people at different times and they have all asked for the recipe. If your trying your hand for the first time and looking for something delicious this is it. Tip: crank up the heat a bit by adding an extra helping of cayenne pepper, and some chili flakes, also using skinless boneless chicken thighs changes it up and makes it very tender.
